title: South Live: Tuesday 5 September - BBC News
summary: officers face misconduct hearing over drowned teenage case .
ex-mp to be hampshire deputy police and crime commissioner .

documents.title: goodbye !
text: the bbc south live service will resume at 08:00 on wednesday , when we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight , berkshire and oxfordshire .
you can get in touch anytime with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: drainage works due to start on b3272 in eversley
text: operation resilience drainage improvements on b3272 reading road , eversley , programmed to start 15 sept for 2 weeks

documents.title: oxford ranked 'world 's top university '
text: the university of oxford is top of the times higher education world university rankings .
each institution is measured in teaching , research , international outlook and income .
a key factor in the rankings is income and oxford saw this rise by 24 % in the past year , partly in the form of european union research grants .
rankings director phil baty said : `` the uk has many of the very best universities in the world and it has one of the world 's strongest higher education systems . ''

documents.title: pilot barred woman with mental disorder
text: pilot barred woman with mental disorder

documents.title: video : ferry companies ' concern as traffickers target the south
text: there 's been a big increase in the number of migrants trying to get into britain using spanish ferries to the south coast .
albanian gangs have switched their focus to the port of bilbao after the closure of the jungle camp at calais .
they 've been targeting routes into poole and portsmouth prompting the spanish port to step up security measures .

documents.title: reading festival death teen 'had carrier bag over head '
text: a teenager who died in a tent at the reading festival was found with a carrier bag tied over his head , an inquest has heard .
matthew jones , 17 , was found `` unresponsive and not breathing '' by friends on 28 august , oxford coroner 's court was told .
paramedics were called but matthew , from leighton buzzard in bedfordshire , was pronounced dead at 02:17 bst .
the inquest was adjourned until 10 january .

documents.title: tribute paid to young soldier killed in motorcycle crash
text: a young soldier who died in a motorcycle crash was a `` kind , caring , cheeky young lad with so much ahead of him '' , his family has said .
jack prebble , 18 , of durley in hampshire , had joined the army in june .
he was riding his motorbike in bishop 's waltham on saturday when the crash happened .
no other vehicles were involved .
jack really was such a kind , caring , cheeky young lad with so much ahead of him , thriving in doing what he loved .
he joined the army last june and was going from strength to strength and enjoying every moment .
we are so proud of jack for what he has achieved in his life , he could light up a room with his smile .
we can not find words to describe how we feel as a family , we are just completely heartbroken .
jack we love you , we are proud of you and every day we will miss you .

documents.title: drowned teen police face misconduct case
text: drowned teen police face misconduct case

documents.title: awe trident workers get 'best possible deal ' in pensions dispute settlement
text: workers at a nuclear warhead factory in berkshire who voted to end a long-running dispute over pension got `` the best possible deal available '' after settling with the company , the union unite has said .
members of the union have been staging a series of walk-outs at the atomic weapons establishment ( awe ) since november 2016 .
they voted to end the dispute on friday .

unite said its 800 members had accepted a 4 % pay deal for each of the next three years and `` enhanced allowances '' , in return for dropping its campaign for reinstatement to the ministry of defence pension scheme .
awe , which has facilities in burghfield and aldermaston , said it was pleased the dispute was over .

documents.title: rain frustrates hampshire and surrey
text: rain frustrates hampshire and surrey

documents.title: ellis downes drowning : officers showed 'lack of professionalism '
text: three police officers will face misconduct proceedings over their dealings with the family of a teenager who drowned in a river .
the family of ellis downes said they had to hire a boat and find private divers to recover his body after being left without police help .
ellis , 16 , died after getting into difficulties in the river thames .
the independent police complaints commission [ ipcc ] said the officers `` have a case to answer for misconduct '' .

in a facebook video message , assistant chief constable nikki ross said she was `` profoundly sorry '' for the `` level of support , the level of compassion , the lack of information and communication '' .

documents.title: weather outlook : cloudy and humid
text: it will stay cloudy and humid this afternoon with the odd outbreak of rain , though it will turn drier , brighter and fresher .
tonight , temperatures will fall much lower than last night and it will stay dry into tomorrow with highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: eastleigh lakeside railway seeks volunteers
text: after 25 years in operation , eastleigh lakeside railway in hampshire needs a new generation of volunteers to help keep its trains running .

documents.title: motorcyclist in life-threatening condition after isle of wight four-vehicle crash
text: a motorcyclist has suffered life-threatening injuries in a four-vehicle crash on the isle of wight .
the collision , involving an orange ktm motorbike , a mazda , a lorry and a vauxhall vivaro , happened on newport road , cowes , just before 17:00 bst on monday .
the motorcyclist , a 39-year-old man from cowes , suffered life-threatening injuries and was taken to hospital .
no-one else was injured .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: oxfordshire council pays police to tackle parking issues
text: an oxfordshire council has decided to pay the police to tackle illegal parking .
cherwell district council says concern has been expressed for `` many years '' about the problem .
it 's setting aside £ 30,000 to fund pcso time to carry out special patrols .
author: Sophie Law
BBC Radio Oxford news

documents.title: oxford defender sidelined for a month
text: oxford defender sidelined for a month

documents.title: fallen tree partially blocks a35 at wool
text: road partially blocked due to a fallen tree

documents.title: three people injured in a31 crash
text: three people have been injured in a two-vehicle crash on the a31 in dorset .

the ambulance service said the collision between a lorry and a car happened between the shell roundabout in winterborne kingston and roundhouse roundabout in sturminster marshall just before 11:00 bst .
the road is currently closed in this area .

documents.title: ex-premier league footballer sam sodje in court over alleged money laundering
text: three footballer brothers helped launder cash from an £ 80,000 international fraud , a court has heard .

retired premier league player sam sodje - who appeared for a number of clubs including reading , portsmouth and charlton athletic , and represented nigeria at international level - along with siblings efe and akpo , were allegedly involved in channelling proceeds from the scam which targeted firms in colombia , india , italy and abu dhabi .
sam and efe sodje are on trial at the old bailey along with two other men , emmanuel ehikhamen and andrew oruma .
akpo sodje now lives in dubai and has declined to return to the uk to be interviewed by detectives .

documents.title: oxford head criticised over reaction to homosexuality comments
text: students have called for the head of oxford university to apologise for defending professors expressing views `` against homosexuality '' .
vice-chancellor louise richardson said she had had `` many conversations '' with students uncomfortable with the attitudes of university staff .
she said she told them : `` my job is n't to make you feel comfortable . ''
the student union 's lgbtq+ campaign said it was `` angered and dismayed '' by her comments and she should apologise .

documents.title: mp 's fears over rail electrification
text: oxford mp fears plans to run electric trains between didcot and oxford 'may never happen '
now there 's a surprise .

text: # traveldorsetalert : a31 - closed both ways between shell roundabout & roundhouse roundabout due to an accident .
police directing traffic .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: new options for highcliffe beach access to be revealed
text: new options for an access route to a beach in christchurch are expected to be revealed later , after plans to rebuild the cliff path were scrapped .
the `` zig-zag '' path at highcliffe castle , with the beach below , was closed by christchurch borough council in march amid safety fears .
plans to rebuild it were scrapped last month after it was estimated it could cost up to £ 1.25m .
the authority said it was looking to make the path safe and exploring other options to give access to the beach , which will be discussed at a full council meeting later .
members of the public have said closing the path would leave no access for the disabled or young families with pushchairs .

documents.title: over 3000 people have now signed a petition urging christchurch council to repair a disabled access path to the beach
text: over 3000 people have now signed a petition urging christchurch council to repair a disabled access path to the beach

documents.title: woman seriously injured in bournemouth alleyway attack
text: a woman has suffered serious head injuries after being attacked in an alleyway in bournemouth .
the woman , in her 20s , was found off christchurch road , close to corpus christi church , at about 22:30 bst on monday .
she was taken to hospital .
a 19-year-old man from bournemouth was arrested on sus of committing grievous bodily harm with intent and is assisting officers with inquiries , dorset police said .
it is believed they are known to each other .

documents.title: self-driving cars to be unveiled
text: the driven consortium , led by oxfordshire 's oxbotica , is giving the public a first look at its self-driving cars today .
in total , six vehicles will make up the fleet launched by the consortium , a group of british firms backed by government money .
today they 've unveiling the first three of those , a white and blue 2014 ford fusion titanium hybrid , a 2017 ford mondeo hybrid and a range rover evoque .
oxfordshire county council leader ian hudspeth said : `` the work being done now will ultimately shape the future of oxfordshire and the uk .
`` decisions on infrastructure and future-proofing are happening now as we start to see autonomous vehicles move closer to being a day-to-day reality on our roads . ''
author: Sophie Law
BBC Radio Oxford news

documents.title: breakingthree officers to face misconduct charges over drowned teenager case
text: three police officers have a `` case to answer '' for incivility and lack of professionalism in their dealings with the family of ellis downes , according to a report by the independent police complaints commission .
the 16-year-old drowned after getting into difficulties while swimming in the thames at culham , oxfordshire , in may last year .
his family have said they were forced to hire a boat and find private divers to recover his body when they were left without police help .

the officers face a misconduct meeting , while thames valley police will also implement improved bereavement training for frontline officers after complaints from the downes family about how they were dealt with by cid officers , the ippc said .
other recommendations include :

documents.title: former mp appointed deputy crime commissioner
text: a former hampshire mp who lost her seat in june 's general election is to start work as the county 's deputy police and crime commissioner .
flick drummond served as the conservative mp for portsmouth south for two years , before losing her seat to labour .
she will be paid £ 64,000 per annum for the role .
the former mp for portsmouth south @ twitterid is to become deputy police and crime commissioner for hampshire & isle of wight .
i get paid 22k a year as front line substance misuse worker .

documents.title: meet the uk 's most popular female gamer
text: one of the uk 's most successful female gamers has been talking about the highs and lows of life on streaming site twitch .
twenty-six-year-old @ twitterid from hampshire , says she earns more than the average household income from playing games online and charging people to watch her .

documents.title: 'brilliant student ' can stay in uk
text: a `` brilliant student '' who faced being deported and losing his place at oxford university can stay in the uk indefinitely , the home office said .
brian white , 21 , moved from botswana aged 15 with his adoptive british family and lives in wolverhampton .
an application for him to become a british citizen at 18 was rejected and he feared losing his place at oxford .
mr white said he was `` delighted '' at the news .
his next step was to obtain student finance , he said .

text: good morning and welcome to south live on tuesday 5 september .
we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across dorset , hampshire , the isle of wight , berkshire and oxfordshire until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our hampshire , dorset , berkshire and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
